question: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and no existing debt?
true_answer: With an annual income of $80,000 and no existing debt, you can afford a home loan of approximately $320,000, assuming a DTI of 30% and a standard interest rate.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and no existing debt?
Plan: 1) Evaluate income-to-loan ratio. 2) Consult home_loan_agent for loan affordability criteria. 3) Calculate potential loan using calculator. 4) Supervisor checks. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on loan affordability criteria based on income.
Typically, lenders allow up to 30-35% of income for mortgage payments.
Calculating maximum loan based on 30% of $80,000 income.
Calculating total loan amount based on monthly payment of $2,000 at standard interest rate.
What if the interest rates go up?
Retrieving information on the impact of rising interest rates on loan affordability.
Higher interest rates reduce the maximum loan amount due to increased monthly payments.
With an income of $80,000 and no debt, you can afford a loan of approximately $320,000. Rising interest rates would decrease this amount.
